name: Hilton Mystic

reviews.text: Just stayed at the Mystic Hilton with my extended family. We were so impressed with the service (big shout out to concierge Bob and front desk clerk Mike), the comfortable beds and the location. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Great service, perfect spot for a Mystic trip

reviews.text: We stayed here 2 nights for quick Mystic getaway with kids. Hotel very conveniently right off I-95 and across the street from Mystic Aquarium. 5-7 minute drive to Mystic seaport and shops.
reviews.title: Good choice for Mystic

reviews.text: Hilton was just as advertised and provided everything we needed-- good location, comfortable rooms, swimming pool, great price on rooms (through Priceline.)
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only small negative I can think of is that the TV's in the rooms are old, 25-inch non-HD sets... kind of surprising for a nice property like this but not a big deal for us since we weren't there to watch television.
reviews.title: Great stay nice hotel

reviews.text: Loved this hotel. Great rooms, staff is very attentive, AWESOME breakfast!! Fresh fruit, bagels, pastries, sausage, bacon, eggs, homefries..top notch bfast..didn't expect it.
reviews.title: GREAT PLACE TO STAY
Service was great and we had such a nice time
reviews.text: We booked this hotel online for a night and got a wonderful deal because we reserved it 2 months prior to staying. We decided to stay here for the night because we were getting married and couldn't get time off to go on our honeymoon right away and wanted to do something fun, so we went to the Aquarium and the shops. We're going to Playa Del Carmen, June 2010 for our delayed honeymoon! Anyway, we got here and checked in with Kimberly at the front desk, she said to me, those roses are beautiful, I thanked her and told her we had just got married. She congratulated us and said another couple was staying here that had got married the previous year and stayed here on their wedding night. We went up to our room, which was very spacious and comfortable, then we had a knock at our door and we had only been in there 5 minutes. My husband went to the door and they upgraded our room to a jacuzzi suite. We called Kimberly and thanked her, we thought that was so nice. 10 minutes later there was another knock at our door in the new room and they sent chocolate covered strawberries and 2 free drink cards for the bar downstairs. So later on we went down to the bar and it was very cozy. They had classic rock playing and a fireplace going. The lighting was very suttle and the chairs were so comfy. The food was great, gave huge portions. We had a great time staying at this hotel and found the service to be exceptional. Also, the location is great for the Aquarium and shops...right across the street. Thanks again for such a wonderful stay.

reviews.title: Great Place to Stay when in Mystic, Great Location
reviews.text: We stayed a night in Mystic, and we stayed at the Hilton, it was great. The rooms were spacious and clean, and the bed was extremely comfortable. There was a nice heated in door pool, it was great to take a dip in at the end of a long day. There was a fitness facility, and a lounge downstairs, and a resteraunt. The hotel was very nice inside, and had the capacity to hold weddings and meetings. The service was excellent there was a bellman right as you walked in to help you. The Location was great it was right across the street from The Olde Mystic Village Shops (which include resteraunts), the aquarium, and a Starbucks, some other shops. I really enjoyed my stay and the only problem I has was I could hear the tv in the next room, I don't know if they had the tv up really loud or if they were thin walls,but our doors were right next to each other and I could hear them every once and a while. I would def reccomend staying here, it was really nice.

reviews.title: One night stay was clean and friendly.....
reviews.text: Nice hotel for the price. Defiantly one of the better ones in the area. Slept well and it was very very clean....

reviews.title: great for a short stay
reviews.text: I got a great last-minute deal on a room here from Priceline. It could not have had a better location. It was great to walk across the street to the Aquarium and Old Mystic shopping, and it was only a short drive to the Seaport. The room was very spacious with windows you could actually open - I love that. Beds were very comfy. We did not dine there, but saw there was a cheap buffet of dinner food for children in the bar. The pool, open til 10, is perfect for kids. Would stay again.

reviews.title: Great location - hotel is a bit worn
reviews.text: The hotel is directly across from the aquarium, park and walk right there. It's also one of the closer ones to town, For this reason, it's a popular choice. Due to that popularity, the hotel seems a bit worn down. could really use a painting and good cleaning. The hallways & rooms are echo chambers - could literally hear the person next door snoring.

reviews.title: Great place to stay near Mystic Seaboard and Aquarium.
reviews.text: Nice hotel with plenty of nearby restaurants and attractions. I wished that I could have spent more time here.

reviews.title: Fabulous location
reviews.text: I will definitely return to the Hilton Mystic. The staff was charming, and courteous to me and my husband. We weren't sure about resturants to go to, and stopped by the front desk for some reccommendations. The staff at the desk seemed to know a lot about every resturant and gave great personal opinions. The indoor pool was very clean and relaxing. I did have a problemn with my television, but a maintenence worker was sent up right away to solve the problem. I will recommend this hotel to all my friends and family in the future and I hope to return soon.

reviews.title: Good location, nice rooms
reviews.text: I stayed here for two nights and for the most part it was fine. The hotel is in a good location right down the road from the aquarium, maybe about 5 minutes from the seaport area and just a little further than that are the restaurants and mystic pizza.

reviews.title: A disaster so far...
reviews.text: We checked in early no problem, but when we got to the room we noticed the Air Conditioner was a little noisy. We figured we'll see how it is later when we get back to the room. It was still loud maybe even worse than before so we called the front desk, they sent someone right up to look at it and he said it needed to be replaced. Fine. They moved us right down the hall to another room and brought keys up to us.

reviews.title: Have stayed here twice, won't stay again.
reviews.text: The next day we went out for the day and when we got back to the hotel our keys weren't working which happens and as I'm waiting at the front desk the couple in front of us were complaining that their room was not cleaned yet. This is around 3 in the afternoon. Well we finally get up to our room and ours isn't cleaned yet either. Pretty surprising since they usually do this pretty early in the morning and this also isn't one of their bigger hotels. So again we call down and they send someone up.

Stayed at this Hilton for one night and really enjoyed our stay. Our room was on the top floor and it was very clean and comfortable. The king size bed we slept in was nice and fluffy and we slept well. We did get a chance to eat dinner in their restaurant and the food was fairly good to match the reasonable prices; my kids particularly enjoyed their chicken fingers and crisp steak fries. My salmon was moist and delicious but I did not care for their plain white jasmine rice.
reviews.title: Very Nice Quiet and Peaceful Getaway!

reviews.text: The hotel has a decent sized indoor swimming pool that my family enjoyed, although it tends to be over crowded at certain times. They also have a small gymnasium that can satisfy your workout needs while you are on the road. The staff in this hotel appear to be cordial and polite, but I was not feeling the genuine friendly warmth that I have experienced at other places I have visited; especially the restaurant staff appeared to be doing their job of preparing and serving your food...nothing more than that.
reviews.title: Good rooms and breakfast, great location, pool area questionable

reviews.text: All in all, this is a good place to go to with your family and enjoy some quietness while being educated with the nearby Mystic Aquarium and Mystic Seaport. If you are planning a wedding or retreat this hotel will be great!
reviews.title: Great Hotel and Location
Mystic Hilton - very good vs. cost
reviews.text: While the room and breakfast were great, the pool area did not look like it was cleaned well from the day before. It was very busy as it was school vacation week, and more of an effort should have been made. It was not completely dirty, but it wasn't as clean as I would have liked it. Also, there never seemed to be enough pool towels. The beds were comfy and it was quiet, and it's location directly across from the Mystic Aquarium can't be beat. I would stay here again.

reviews.title: NOT a "Hilton" experience - Do not be fooled
reviews.text: It’s rare that I post on Trip Advisor however I was apart of an Entertainment Group that stayed with the Hilton Mystic and I beg to differ from some of these comments. The Rooms were nice, yes I agree that the hotel could use some updating however they were clean and comfortable. The pool was unfortunately packed with kids but that’s the expectation when you go to a family destination like Mystic especially a hotel like this that is centrally located. Have you been to Disney and not found pools and game rooms swamped with kids? We found the staff to be extremely nice and accommodating. As an entertainment group we can be very needy due to the nature of our Tour the Front Desk and Bell Staff bent backwards to make sure that our group was comfortable. There was an Evening Manager's reception with Free Beer and Wine that was a nice touch. We stayed at the Mystic Marriott on our last tour and while it was a nice hotel there is NOTHING THERE!!!! You cannot walk to anything if you stay at the Mystic Marriott, it's actually not even in Mystic it's in Groton which is a sketchy area at best.

This Hilton is in need of a facelift. The lobby and restaurant are very nice, yet the halls and the room I was in was in need of complete renovation. I am Hilton Gold and was not offered an upgrade (even though the property seemed like a ghost town), I could have used a larger room, as I was traveling with my 2 kids.
reviews.title: Nice Staff, OK property

reviews.text: The restaurant food was quite good for both dinner and for breakfast (yet a bit on the expensive side)....
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed Halloween weekend and was immersed in the festivities. Village across the road, as well as aquarium. Room very spacious and tidy, bathroom products good and clean facilities. Room service quick and staff friendly. Noted free internet on TV that did not work and was then charged very high rate in business centre which was very disappointing. Large hotel with weddings and conferences occuring. Did not have a car but close to bus stop to providence and nyc. More difficult to get to other parts of the area ( you really do need car).
reviews.title: Nice and Clean, but in need of an update

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, the staff was very courteous and even asked us what floor we would prefer. But on our way to the room, (3rd Floor) the carpet was all bubbled up and our room had a musty old smell. It was a little off -putting, especially for a Hilton where you would expect quality. One of the elevators appeared to be out of service, and you had to wait FOREVER to get up and down, so we opted to take the stairs. The bedroom wasn't bad and the bed was super comfortable! However, they must have no insulation between their walls because we could hear our neighbor's tv very loudy and a baby could be heard crying on the other side.
reviews.title: $75-$125 OKAY, anything more - Stay in GROTON or on the resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If your looking to shop and stay in Mystic, the location is right behind Old Mystic Port shopping center. If your going to Foxwoods (8mi), or Mohegun (12mi) you will find it is a very confusing and winding road to get Foxwoods, and convenient highway driving to Mohegun.
reviews.title: Would stay again if I had a coupon.

reviews.text: Great housekeeping and staff was friendly, other than that not much to rate high. Food was not very good and prices in Bar were very high. The hotel needs updating, marks all over walls. Room was quiet and clean but had a smell at times, like too much cleaner used. Housekeeping was the best, she did great, as did the front desk. Unfortunately we won't stay again.
reviews.title: Stayed 5 nights

reviews.text: My family stayed at the Hilton in Mystic the night before Easter. The staff was very friendly. The pool was very clean as were the rooms. Our Breakfast buffet the next morning was perfect. No complaints Cant wait to stay again next year.
reviews.title: Easter weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was spacious, well kept and clean. Lobby and bar wre very nice - wood burning fireplace a very nice touch! Would have loved to spend more time in the bar, but drinks were kinda pricey. Otherwise, loved our visit!!
reviews.title: Hilton Mystic - great time!

reviews.text: Skeleton staff who were not overly friendly. Questionable cleanliness of some areas. Food relatively good but costly. Location is ideal, if going to the Aquarium. Walking distance to shopping and food.
reviews.title: With a name like Hilton, it has to be good.

reviews.text: This is the third time we have stayed at the Hilton in Mystic! Close to all and the food is actually really good! The bar has friendly bartenders and make great drinks! We celebrated our daughters first birthday there last year and came back again this year for her 2nd! The staff were amazing, they gave her cookies a birthday card and milk all set up in our room upon arrival! The manager Lauren even came up to say "Happy Birthday" and told us if we needed anything to just let the front desk know and they would bring it right up! Our baby woke up wanting milk at 3am and the front desk person went and brought up warm milk even though we only called down to see if we could get milk from downstairs, they said " No worries, we will bring you some" Very nice and look forward to coming back!! Room was clean and comfy, Cannot complain about a darn thing, Thank You Hilton Mystic and Lauren the front end manager!!! Love love love!!
reviews.title: Outstanding! Schriefer vacation at Mystic #3

reviews.text: Very good stay with the Family for a weekend. Fairly priced and clean. The hotel could use a makeover for my tastes, but still very good for Mystic. Location is perfect for a weekend with the Family. Across the street from the Aquarium and Shops, all you have to do is park the car and let loose for a day or too. Kids had a ball.
reviews.title: Very good.

reviews.text: We & 3 grandkids visited President's weekend - Sun-Tues. Staff was kind to put in a roll-away. The location, restaurant & pool great!. However, when the wind blew (-17 w chill) on Sunday, the wind blew into the room around the wall-mounted air-cond & under the granite window sills. Nothing sealed! Repeated assistance ignored as hotel full. Towels and blankets stuffed to stop the wind helped but room still cold/thermosat set to 88. Would return but problem needs a fix.
reviews.title: Great hotel but winter wind blows in

reviews.text: Just an overnight as daughter had tournament at CT College next day. Very average hotel. Nothing special. Elevator smelled terrible. Lots of stains on the rugs. Food that had apparently been dropped in front of the elevator remained there over night. In the middle of the night the heater/ac unit began making very loud noises waking us up. Constant adjusting would make it stop for short amounts of time. Told the front desk about it in the a.m. and the woman (with a very rude attitude) advised me I should have called the front desk. I had considered it, but in the middle of the night, someone working on it or moving rooms would have been even more disruptive. I don't have an issue that there was a problem, just with the attitude at the front desk.
reviews.title: Average says it all.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel looks great from the outside, but once inside you realize it is in need of a major facelift! The decor is out-dated and the rooms definitely need to be renovated (new pillows, mattresses, & towels PLEASE!). You are paying a lot for an unappealing room. We also had a FOREVER long walk to our room. We were at the far end of the hotel, but you could only get there going through the lobby so we had to walk down a long hallway with lots of turns. We were also placed next to a Canadian bust tour group-so at 6am when they had to leave-they were dragging out luggage, banging doors, and talking loudly-thank you for the unsolicited wake up call! As for the service-it was terrible! They told us a shuttle would be running all night to the waterfront and to just call when we were done, so we did. They said someone would be right there-then we waited, and waited, and waited outside in the freezing weather, and no one showed! They then said they didn't have a driver, so to call a cab-which took another 30 minutes to arrive! We froze! The breakfast buffet they have is terrible-it is all cafeteria quality food and it just sits out forever without being replaced. The tables are left unbussed. We found a long hair baked into the pancakes. Just very turned off! We would never stay there again and hope you don't either.
reviews.title: Out-dated, poor service, & dirty

reviews.text: Restaurant was terrible, pool was small and definately needed a good cleaning- towels ran out as soon as they were placed out for the guests- room was average and the bar was sub par- they actually ran out of glasses one night while I was there!!! People who frequent this place often and give it anything over 3 stars need to get out more- this is by no means a 4 star hotel and 3 is a gift!!!
reviews.title: average

reviews.text: Our family has stayed at this hotel numerous times, even though we live a mere 45 minutes away. The hotel is very clean, service is good, rooms are immaculate and the breakfast buffet is substantial.
reviews.title: Great hotel for families. Good bargain off season.
Mystic Hilton ~ TOO "family friendly"
reviews.text: We like to visit this hotel in the winter when the prices are lower and we can have a fun weekend excursion - visiting the aquarium, Mistick Village and other sites in Mystic, and swimming in the hotel pool. The hotel is quite large. I saw other reviews mention the meandering hallways and distance to elevators. This is true, however, they have luggage carts always available at the front entrance. We use these for the bags --and even put our kids on to give them a ride to the room.

My only minor complaint is that in the past we've had multiple family members staying in different rooms on the same night. The hotel has not accommodated our specific requests to have the rooms close by to one another. The hotel tried to graciously remedy the problem. I think the issue stems from the corporate 1-800 number not being aligned with the hotel itself (if you book through the main #).
reviews.title: Needs to be updated and jody deserves a raise

reviews.text: Overall, I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Girls Trip

reviews.text: Again, gorgeous hotel. But after making requests, I was still led down the path of so many others who wrote reviews. If you are not in the front of the hotel, it seems, you will walk down miles of twisting and turning carpeted hallways. If you have bags, or children, this will not do. I called the front desk, and they changed us to the front of the hotel. Much better. Except for the children running and screaming to and from the pool constantly, and playing tag with the bell carts at all hours. Location is indeed, directly across from the Aquarium, if you decide to waste your money on that. Scratched tanks, and chaos like a free day of miniature golf in Pigeon Forge !! But DO NOT miss Peking China restaurant (also across the street). Very reasonable and very divine !! If you have more days, you MUST order a "Mystic Pizza" delivered to your room. DEEEElish. As different as New York pizza is, to Dominos ! I SO wish they delivered to Florida !!!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

description: In the heart of Mystic, Connecticut, just one block from Interstate-95, Conveniently located for both corporate and leisure visitors alike. You’ll appreciate our convenient location as a coastal stopping point between New York City and Boston, MA, filled with historic charm of maritime New England.
